title: Extramammary Paget's Disease in Two Brothers
patient: A 56-year-old Chinese man presented with an 8-year history of itchy erythema on the right scrotum that had gradually increased in size. His brother (case 1) had been diagnosed as invasive EMPD a few days ago. A biopsy specimen indicated EMPD from the other hospital. Therefore, he was referred to Urology Department of our hospital in January 2013. Physical examination revealed an erythematous plaque on the right scrotum to the basal portion of the penis, measuring 60 × 35 mm. He underwent a wide local excision with SLNB. FSE showed clear surgical margins. The pathology report of the skin lesion postoperative [] was in accordance to preoperative. The SLNB showed no tumor invasion. The immunohistochemistry of the skin was CK7+, CK20 –, GCDFP15+, EMA+. Fifteen months after surgery, the patient is alive and without recurrence.
